page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: We went to the Cross Roads Garage. They have a 24 hour breakdown and recovery service for cars and lorries. The garage sells petrol and sweets. They mend cars and test cars and do bodywork. We made some charts about vehicles. On Monday at 9.55 a.m. there was one motor bike, four vans, one tractor, and one lorry going past the school. On Tuesday at 1.30 p.m. we stood outside the school and we watched the traffic from there. We found that there were more cars coming out of the village than into the village. We went on to the main road and on Monday we had sixteen cars going to Daventry and twenty two going to Southam. There were more lorries going to Daventry because there are more factories there and you can go on to the motorway at Daventry.
